episodeTitle: The Dream Sinking in the New World! The Disillusioned Pirate, Puzzle!
description: The Straw Hats become trapped by mysteriously moving icebergs while bounty hunters close in. Meanwhile, Puzzle, captain of the Phoenix Pirates, awakens and reveals the devastating truth about his crew's defeat in the New World and his decision to abandon their pirate dreams.

events.title: Straw Hats Encounter Moving Icebergs
events.description: The Thousand Sunny and the Phoenix Pirates' ship find themselves surrounded by icebergs that move independently and unnaturally. Nami recognizes the danger as the massive ice formations begin to close in on them.
events.significance: First indication that the Straw Hats are entering the territory controlled by the Accino Family bounty hunters, setting up the main conflict of the episode.

quotes.text: These icebergs are moving on their own!
quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Nami warns the crew about the unusual iceberg movements

events.title: Zoro Cuts Iceberg in Half
events.description: To prove the icebergs are indeed moving and threatening the ships, Zoro demonstrates by slicing one of the massive icebergs cleanly in half with his swords.
events.significance: Confirms that the icebergs are being controlled by an outside force and demonstrates the immediate danger to both crews.

events.title: Puzzle Awakens from Fever
events.description: Puzzle, the captain of the Phoenix Pirates, regains consciousness after being treated by Chopper. His crew gathers around him with hope that he will lead them back to the New World.
events.significance: Introduces Puzzle as a character and sets up his character arc of overcoming despair and regaining his determination as a pirate captain.

quotes.speaker: Jiro
quotes.context: Jiro's relief at seeing Puzzle recover

events.title: Flashback to Phoenix Pirates' New World Defeat
events.description: Through flashback, Jiro recounts to Puzzle how the Phoenix Pirates were attacked by a powerful enemy in the New World. The crew was vastly outnumbered and their ship came under devastating attack from what appeared to be meteor-like bombardments.
events.significance: Reveals the traumatic event that led to the Phoenix Pirates' current situation working for the Accino Family, establishing Puzzle's despair and loss of confidence.

events.title: Vigaro's Sacrifice
events.description: During the flashback, Vigaro, the first mate and vice-captain of the Phoenix Pirates, sacrifices himself to disable the pursuing enemy ship's rudder, allowing Puzzle and the rest of the crew to escape. He pays for this heroic action with his life.
events.significance: The death of Vigaro is the traumatic core event that broke Puzzle's spirit and led to his decision to give up being a pirate. This sacrifice haunts Puzzle throughout the arc until he regains his resolve.

quotes.text: I trust you completely, Captain. I'll make sure you escape safely!
quotes.speaker: Vigaro
quotes.context: Vigaro's final words before sacrificing himself

events.title: Puzzle Declares They Are No Longer Pirates
events.description: After hearing about Vigaro's death again, Puzzle devastates his crew by declaring they will not return to the New World, that they are no longer pirates, and that their pride is gone. He states that working for the Accino Family as bounty hunters is the smartest solution.
events.significance: This is the low point of Puzzle's character arc, showing how completely his spirit has been broken by the loss of his first mate. His crew is shocked and demoralized by this announcement.

quotes.text: We aren't going back to the New World. We aren't pirates anymore. Our pride is gone.
quotes.speaker: Puzzle
quotes.context: Puzzle's crushing declaration to his crew

quotes.text: Stansen was right. Working for the Accino Family is the smartest solution.
quotes.speaker: Puzzle
quotes.context: Puzzle accepts their current situation as bounty hunter subordinates

events.title: Puzzle Regrets His Cockiness
events.description: Puzzle reflects on how Vigaro had warned him about the dangers of the New World, but he had arrogantly replied that he was a phoenix and would always rise again. Now he deeply regrets that cockiness that led to his first mate's death.
events.significance: Shows Puzzle's guilt and self-blame over Vigaro's death, explaining why he's lost his will to be a pirate. His phoenix metaphor of rising from defeat is now hollow to him.

quotes.text: I told him I was a phoenix... that I would always rise again. I was so arrogant.
quotes.speaker: Puzzle
quotes.context: Puzzle reflecting on his past overconfidence

events.title: Icebergs Attack the Ships
events.description: The controlled icebergs begin actively attacking and attempting to trap both the Thousand Sunny and the Phoenix Pirates' ship. The Straw Hats realize they're being deliberately guided somewhere by an external force.
events.significance: Escalates the immediate danger and confirms the Accino Family is actively herding the ships into a trap at Lovely Land.

events.title: Thousand Sunny Uses Coup de Burst
events.description: With the ship trapped by converging icebergs and swirling whirlpools, Franky activates the Thousand Sunny's special escape mechanism, the Coup de Burst, to blast the ship free from the ice trap.
events.significance: Demonstrates one of the Thousand Sunny's special functions introduced in the previous arc, showing how the ship's advanced features help the crew escape dangerous situations.

events.title: Luffy Mistakes Iceberg for Dessert
events.description: In a comedic moment typical of Luffy's character, he mistakes a massive iceberg for some kind of frozen dessert and destroys it with his attacks, thinking it's food.
events.significance: Provides comic relief and reinforces Luffy's single-minded focus on food, maintaining the series' lighter tone even during tense moments.

events.title: Zoro Gets Separated and Lost
events.description: During the chaos of escaping the icebergs, Zoro becomes separated from the main group. True to his character, he immediately gets lost in the maze of ice formations.
events.significance: A running gag with Zoro's terrible sense of direction, while also splitting up the crew for different encounter scenarios in future episodes.

events.title: Luffy and Chopper Separated from Thousand Sunny
events.description: During the iceberg attacks, the rope connecting the Phoenix Pirates' ship to the Thousand Sunny is severed. Luffy and Chopper, who were on the Phoenix Pirates' ship, become separated from the rest of the Straw Hat crew.
events.significance: Splits the Straw Hats into two groups, setting up parallel storylines for the arc and forcing Luffy to work with the Phoenix Pirates.

events.title: Straw Hat Jolly Roger Flag Stolen
events.description: A little girl riding a flying fish appears and steals the Straw Hat Pirates' Jolly Roger flag from the Thousand Sunny. The Accino Family bounty hunters have successfully obtained their prize.
events.significance: This theft becomes the central conflict driving the arc forward, as retrieving their stolen flag becomes a matter of pride and honor for the Straw Hat crew.

events.title: Accino Family Pursues Both Crews
events.description: The Accino Family bounty hunters learn that Puzzle has survived and begin pursuing both the Straw Hat Pirates and the Phoenix Pirates, seeking the substantial bounty rewards on their heads.
events.significance: Establishes that both crews are now targets, setting up future confrontations and giving the Phoenix Pirates a stake in the coming battles.

quotes.speaker: Puzzle
quotes.context: Puzzle's devastating declaration to his crew after awakening

quotes.text: I trust you completely, Captain. I'll make sure you escape safely!
quotes.speaker: Vigaro
quotes.context: Vigaro's final words before sacrificing himself in the New World

quotes.text: I told him I was a phoenix... that I would always rise again. I was so arrogant.
quotes.speaker: Puzzle
quotes.context: Puzzle regretting his past overconfidence that led to Vigaro's death

quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Nami warning the crew about the controlled icebergs

themes.description: The episode explores how devastating defeat and the death of a comrade can break a person's spirit and sense of self. Puzzle's declaration that they are no longer pirates represents the complete loss of identity and purpose.
themes.symbolism: The phoenix symbolism is inverted - instead of rising from the ashes, Puzzle feels he has been permanently grounded by his defeat and loss.

themes.description: Vigaro's heroic sacrifice to save his captain and crew becomes a source of overwhelming guilt for Puzzle rather than inspiration, showing how survivor's guilt can paralyze even the strongest leaders.
themes.symbolism: The moving icebergs represent how Puzzle feels trapped and controlled by his past trauma.

themes.description: The theft of the Straw Hat Jolly Roger continues the series' theme that a pirate's flag represents their identity, dreams, and pride - making its loss unbearable.
themes.symbolism: The stolen flag symbolizes stolen identity and the challenge to the Straw Hats' honor that they must reclaim.

characterSpotlights.development: Puzzle is introduced as a defeated man who has lost his will to pursue his dreams. His awakening is not triumphant but tragic, as he announces his surrender to his crew's dismay.

characterSpotlights.development: Jiro demonstrates unwavering faith in his captain despite Puzzle's declaration of defeat, showing the youth's idealism and loyalty.

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy's typical carefree nature is on display, but he becomes separated from his crew, setting up his involvement with the Phoenix Pirates.

mangaDifferences.difference: The entire Ice Hunter Arc is anime-original filler content with no manga counterpart.

trivia.fact: This episode is part of the Ice Hunter Arc (episodes 326-335), which is the second-longest anime-original filler arc in One Piece, surpassed only by the G-8 Arc.

sources.title: Ice Hunter Arc - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: The Ice Hunter Arc takes place between the Post-Enies Lobby Arc and the Thriller Bark Arc, during the Straw Hats' journey through the Florian Triangle.

sources.title: Ice Hunter Arc - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: Puzzle has a bounty of 100,000,000 Beli, making him a relatively significant pirate captain, though this is never mentioned in the canon story.
The opening theme 'Jungle P' by 5050 was used from episodes 326-372, spanning the Ice Hunter Arc and into the Thriller Bark Arc.
One Piece stopped using ending themes after episode 278 when the show moved to a Sunday morning timeslot, so episode 328 has no ending song.

sources.title: Why did the anime stop having ending songs since episode 279?

trivia.fact: Jiro is voiced by Miyu Irino in Japanese, who would later become well-known for voicing Haku in Spirited Away and Sora in Kingdom Hearts.
